page.title: 02GEOGRAPHY OF AREA
page.content: {GEOGRAPHY, ECOLOGY AND ENVIRONMENT} The ground undulates gently from the river and the area is dominated by the bulk of distant {Bredon Hill}in the South East. It is a{rich growing} area, soft fruit and salad vegetables are produced in the many market gardens which proliferate in the area. Cattle and sheep graze on the rich grassland but some concern has been expressed locally by the death of the{ {Heron}population, due it is thought, to the use of over powerful pesticides being washed down to the river from bordering fields. {Flooding}is notorious and efforts have been made to alleviate it by controlling the river flow using sluices and "guts" to run off flood water. Despite flooding the Avon attracts an increasing number of tourists to the area.
